item.title: Pokemon Fan Art Imagines Human Forms for Bulbasaur, Ivysaur, and Venusaur
item.description:
A Pokemon fan artist took to social media to share their concepts of what Bulbasaur, Ivysaur, and Venusaur could look like with human forms. The Pokemon fan artist said that their human designs for Bulbasaur and its evolved forms were based on a specific theme, and that their work is part of a larger project that will eventually cover all Gen 1 creatures.

Known as the Seed Pokemon, Bulbasaur and its later forms first appeared in Pokemon Red and Blu e. Bulbasaur is the first Grass-type Starter in the Pokemon franchise that players can choose, with Charmander and Squirtle being its Fire and Water counterparts. The beloved creature evolves into Ivysaur at level 16, followed by Venusaur at level 32. As it evolves, the bulb on Bulbasaur's back begins to open, fully blooming as it becomes a Venusaur. In Pokemon X and Y , Venusaur received a Mega-Evolved form that made the plant on its back grow even further. Mega Venusaur returned in Pokemon Legends: Z-A as a Rogue Mega-Evolved boss that trainers must face during the main story.

Pokemon Fan Artist Depicts Bulbasaur Line With Human Features

Given that Bulbasaur has appeared in many Pokemon games, it is natural that fan artists have made tributes to the Seed Pokemon in their own way. On the franchise's subreddit, Reddit user TheGoblinCodex posted their idea of what Bulbasaur, Ivysaur, and Venusaur could look like as humans, or 'gijinka', and utilized a high fantasy motif for their designs. Bulbasaur was depicted as a child wearing a green kilt, with its bulb strapped to a wooden backpack and various pouches. Bulbasaur also carried a small wooden walking stick with a golden orb on top. Upon evolving to Ivysaur, it gains light green tattoos on its right arm, with the orb on its staff blooming into a golden flower. Ivysaur's bulb is also seen in its lap rather than its back.

Upon becoming a Venusaur, the blooming bulb was instead depicted as a headdress, and tattoos cover its entire torso and half of its face. To this day, the gijinka concept remains popular among Pokémon fan artists, as each artist offers their own take on what a Pokemon like Regirock could look like with human features. In response, other Pokemon fans complimented TheGoblinCodex for their handiwork and theme choices.

TheGoblinCodex said that the Charmander evolution line would be their next art project, and remarked how popular Charizard is among Pokemon fans and artists. It remains to be seen when their next Pokemon fan art project will be completed.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Roblox: Your Goblin Mine Codes (November 2025)
item.description:
Your Goblin Mine is a unique Roblox experience where you can become the owner of a mine filled with greedy goblins. There, you will be able to purchase different ores and use your workers to earn money by mining them. The more resources you have, the faster you progress, and the game allows you to get some free bonuses by activating codes. In this guide, we will tell you all about the active Your Goblin Mine codes and how to redeem them.

Updated November 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are several codes available right now, each offering a different type of reward. You can claim various statues and bonus items that can help you progress more easily. These rewards add small advantages as you expand your collection. More items may appear in later updates, so it can be useful to revisit this guide from time to time.

All Your Goblin Mine Codes

Working Your Goblin Mine Codes

  • 10MILLION – Gives you a 67 Statue. (NEW)
  • 4KPLAYERS – Gives you a Icy Statue.
  • 8KPLAYERS – Gives you a Bag of Cash.
  • 10MILLION – Gives you a Cool Statue that doubles your earnings.

Expired Your Goblin Mine Codes

  • DRAGON
  • Release

Promo codes in Your Goblin Mine reward you with some nice items that can help you develop your facility. The Cool Statue is one of them, and it allows you to double the amount of cash you earn. With it, you will be able to purchase more expensive ores and goblins, which can then be used to increase your income.

Your Goblin Mine promo codes can provide you with some useful freebies, but unfortunately, they tend to expire. You should redeem them as soon as possible if you don't want to lose your bonuses.

How to Redeem Your Goblin Mine Codes

Getting some rewards for free is always nice, but before you can do it, you will need to learn how the redemption process works. Fortunately, it’s not difficult at all, and you can activate Your Goblin Mine codes in just a few clicks. Here’s a list of steps you need to follow to use these coupons and receive your bonuses:

  • Launch Your Goblin Mine and wait for this Roblox game to load.
  • Once you are in the game, complete the tutorial. After that, click on the Store button on the left side of your screen.
  • In the Store menu, scroll down until you see the line where you can type codes.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem.
  • Click on the Enter button.
  • The reward is yours.

How to Get New Your Goblin Mine Codes

The developers of this Roblox experience may add more promo codes in future updates, and if this happens, we will list them in our article. So, you can bookmark this guide and check it from time to time for new Your Goblin Mine codes. Also, you can follow the official media related to this game:

  • X Account
  • Discord Server
Roblox
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

item.title: Roblox: Subway Mayhem Codes (November 2025)
item.description:
Subway Mayhem is one of the representatives of the battlegrounds genre. Therefore, your main task will be to fight other players and throw them out of the arena. And to make battles easier for beginners, the developers add various codes to Subway Mayhem .

By redeeming codes, you will receive free goodies, among which are credits, which are the main currency in this Roblox experience. For this money, you can purchase various customization options, as well as weapons. But hurry because after a certain time, each code expires and the reward becomes no longer available.

Updated November 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Several codes are available right now, and they all provide different amounts of credits to collect. These rewards can help you unlock more items as you continue playing. It’s a simple way to build up your resources without much effort. More opportunities to claim extra credits may appear in future updates, so checking back later can be helpful.

All Subway Mayhem Codes

Working Subway Mayhem Codes

  • EMOTES25 - Redeem this code to get 1,500 Credits (NEW)
  • PTSRELEASE - Redeem this code to get 1,000 Credits
  • FREECASE - Redeem this code to get 1,500 Credits
  • DAILYREWARDS - Redeem this code to get 1,500 Credits

Expired Subway Mayhem Codes

There are no expired codes in Subway Mayhem . We will update this article as soon as more codes becomes available.

Like other representatives of the genre, Subway Mayhem offers you various maps on which you must fight to earn Credits. It is more difficult to do this than it seems, especially if your opponents are skilled players. Many attacks can stun you, which will allow others to either finish you off or throw you over the edge of the arena, so be prepared to spend a lot of time getting used to the combat system. Luckily, there is a way to slightly increase your survival chances, namely using Subway Mayhem codes.

These codes can contain various rewards, although most of them grant you money. For credits, you can buy weapons, such as grenades, to stun several opponents at once. However, we do not recommend delaying the use of Roblox codes, since their validity is limited.

How to Redeem Subway Mayhem Codes

To use Subway Mayhem codes, you only need to make a few clicks. This feature is no different from most other Roblox experiences. And for convenience, follow these steps:

  • First, launch Subway Mayhem .
  • Next, click on the tag icon. You will find it at the top of the screen, to the left of the AFK button.
  • After that, enter the code in the new window.
  • Finally, click the Check button to claim free goodies.

How to Get More Subway Mayhem Codes

To stay up to date with all active Subway Mayhem codes, you should bookmark this guide. We are going to update it over time, as well as our other Roblox articles. Alternatively, you can visit the official developer pages, where you will find all the news first-hand:

  • Daluest Studios Roblox group
  • Daluest Studios Discord server
Roblox
Released
September 1, 2006

item.title: Roblox: Trampoline Training Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Trampoline Training , as the name suggests, challenges you to compete against other players in trampoline jumping. Depending on your training, you can jump dozens of miles in a single jump. But of course, you'll be quite weak at first. Luckily, the developers are releasing Trampoline Training codes to help players.

Each code will reward you with useful items for this Roblox game, such as Cash or Power. This is especially helpful for newcomers, so you won't want to miss out. However, we recommend you hurry, as they have a limited validity period.

Updated November 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A new set of rewards has been added, giving you several fresh bonuses to claim. The latest codes offer different types of potions, along with large boosts to your Power and Cash. These rewards can help you progress faster and experiment with upgrades more easily. More updates may arrive later on, so checking back for new additions is always a good idea.

All Trampoline Training Codes

Working Trampoline Training Codes

  • amazinglikes - Redeem this code to get 3x all Potions (NEW)
  • amazinggroup - Redeem this code to get 25,000 Power (NEW)
  • crazygame - Redeem this code to get 25,000 Cash (NEW)
  • chocoevent - Redeem this code to get 1x all Potions (NEW)
  • release - Redeem this code to get 2,500 Cash
  • wowgroup - Redeem this code to get 15,000 Power
  • wowlikes - Redeem this code to get 2x all Potions
  • halloween - Redeem this code to get 25,000 Cash

Expired Trampoline Training Codes

There are no expired codes in Trampoline Training . We will update this article as soon as more code becomes available.

The Trampoline Training tutorial will show you everything you need to know, specifically training and racing. First, you need to accumulate Energy. The higher this stat, the further you can jump from the trampoline in a race. This, in turn, will reward you with a certain amount of money. You'll also need a lot of Cash to buy equipment and hatch pets. Therefore, we recommend using Trampoline Training codes.

Roblox codes grant players valuable perks from the developers. In addition to Cash and Energy, they can also reward you with potions. Some of these boost your training, while others increase your chance of spawning rare pets. However, they're easy to miss due to their short expiration date.

How to Redeem Trampoline Training Codes

Using Trampoline Training codes takes just a few clicks. This feature works similarly to other Roblox games. But if this is your first time playing, follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch Trampoline Training .
  • Next, click the shopping cart icon on the left side of the screen to open the Shop.
  • Then click the Codes button.
  • Finally, enter the code and hit the Claim button to receive the rewards.

How to Redeem Trampoline Training Codes

Bookmark this guide to be among the first to receive the latest Trampoline Training codes. We will update it as we do with our other Roblox guides. Players can also visit the official developer pages:

  • Official Crusty Gaming Roblox group
  • Official Trampoline Training Discord server
Roblox

item.title: PS1 Games That Deserve The FF7 Remake Treatment
item.description:
Final Fantasy 7 was released for the PS1 in 1997 and quickly rose to power as a dominating force on the console. It’s easy to see why it became a favorite among fans of the franchise, leading Square Enix to greenlight various other Final Fantasy 7 projects, including sequels, prequels, movies, books, and more.

Perhaps the biggest project within this sub-franchise has been the remake trilogy, starting with Final Fantasy 7 Remake in 2020. Serving as both part one of a remake trilogy along with being a secret sequel to the original game, the scope of the story has been greatly expanded in the two entries released so far. Are there any PS1 games that would benefit from this same remake treatment with the same absurd scope and budget?

Final Fantasy 9

More Than Rumors

Final Fantasy 9
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Genre(s)
JRPG
Powered by

There have been rumors about Final Fantasy 9 being the next game to get a remake for a while, and it seems like it would only be a one-and-done situation, not a trilogy. While it would be cool to get a remake of FF9 in any capacity, an expanded adventure would be great for the series, too.

After all, this game was intended to be a send-off to classic Final Fantasy games in 2000. Between Alexandria and Lindblum, these two kingdoms could be so much bigger in a remake. Also, the original Final Fantasy 9 came packaged on four discs, so it was a large adventure already. There's plenty to draw on when planning out a remake.

Metal Gear Solid

Shadow Moses As A Bigger Island

Metal Gear Solid
Stealth
Systems
Released
October 20, 1998
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Suggestive Themes, Violence

Developer(s)
Konami Computer Entertainment Japan
Genre(s)
Stealth
Powered by

Metal Gear Solid was already remade once on the GameCube, a version that has never been re-released. Beyond having snazzier cutscenes, the game itself wasn’t any bigger or better, and it has now been over 20 years since its release. Another modernization is definitely overdue.

The game takes place on an island, Shadow Moses, and Solid Snake sneaks right onto the base during the introduction. That base could be bigger in the remake if the opening remains the same, but letting players explore an open-world island with multiple facilities would be even cooler. The absence of Hideo Kojima at the helm of this project would be sad, but Konami has plenty of talented people still working at the studio who could pull this off.

Mega Man Legends

Island Hopping

Mega Man Legends
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
August 31, 1998
ESRB
e // Animated Violence

Developer(s)
Capcom Production Studio 2
Genre(s)
Action-Adventure
Powered by

Maybe, instead of a sequel, fans could at least play a remake of the first Mega Man Legends game. After the first initial dungeon, Mega Man and crew crash-land on Kattlelox Island, and that’s where the entire game takes place.

A remake could expand the size of the island on top, as well as what they find down below. The remake could also have the island not appear until later into the adventure, instead beginning with the crew investigating other, smaller islands like they did in the sequel. Airship controls would also be an amazing new addition to Mega Man Legends .

Castlevania: Symphony Of The Night

Remaking THE Metroidvania

Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
Released
October 2, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence
Developer(s)
Konami
Genre(s)
Metroidvania, Action RPG
Powered by

Castlevania: Symphony of the Night is one of the main games behind the popularization of the Metroidvania genre, taking what Super Metroid did and adding RPG elements. It’s one of the most beloved entries in the series, as is with Alucard as a playable character.

While there have been attempts at 3D Castlevania games, none of them have hit as hard as the 2D games. A remake of this classic could bridge the gap and incorporate new elements, like going outside the castle walls, or even having more gameplay as Trevor Belmont in the prologue section. It's been a while since the last Castlevania game, so why not start the comeback with the return of the best game in the series?

Dino Crisis

Moving Past Evil

Dino Crisis
Released
August 31, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Survival Horror
Powered by

A Dino Crisis remake is a game Capcom fans have been asking for ever since the developer started remaking Resident Evil games. A sequel would also be nice, but there’s potential in a remake of the first game to get the ball rolling.

Essentially, the premise is Jurassic Park , but one that leans into the horror elements more. Specialists are sent in to investigate why the island goes quiet, only to find that dinosaurs are running amok. The game is set within a secluded research facility, while a remake could expand the scope and feature more outdoor locations and a wider variety of dinosaurs.

Parasite Eve

The Streets Of NYC

Parasite Eve
Released
September 9, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Animated Violence, Mature Sexual Themes
Developer(s)
Square
Genre(s)
Horror, Action RPG
Powered by

Parasite Eve is one of the greatest horror games to ever hit the PS1, because it was also an RPG and very unique in the genre. In many ways, it still is. Taking place in NYC, players could fast travel between locations as they investigate a paranormal case involving people becoming goo and animals mutating.

These areas, including an opera house, a hospital, the police precinct, a zoo, and more, were not that big, and they could definitely have more substance added to them in a remake. Also, allowing players to physically drive their car from place to place would be a big addition, too, helping the city feel more cohesive.

Xenogears

A Second Chance

Xenogears
Released
October 20, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Square
Genre(s)
JRPG
Powered by

Xenogears is a project that got out of hand on the PS1, and it was originally planned to be much larger. The second disc was cut down significantly and featured more dialogue instead of gameplay. If there was ever a game in need of a remake, this game would be it.

A group of developers who worked on Xenogears at Squaresoft at the time went off to form Monolith Soft, which then led to Xenosaga and then Xenoblade Chronicles . It would be amazing if Square Enix collaborated with Monolith Soft and Nintendo to get an exclusive remake on Switch 2.

The Legend Of Dragoon

Adding A Real World

The Legend of Dragoon
Released
June 14, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
JapanStudio
Genre(s)
JRPG
Powered by

The Legend of Dragoon had a similar issue to Parasite Eve , as players could only use the world map to travel to set destinations, rather than traveling there organically. This went against world map designs of most turn-based RPGs at the time, including Final Fantasy 9 , as it decreased the opportunity for exploration. A remake could add more exploration in-between town and dungeon locations.

Also, dragons played a big role in the story, but they weren't as present in the actual gameplay as fans would have liked. A remake could increase their presence throughout, from combat assistance to riding them around the world.
